c730d1c8-b5d6-453d-bd34-0123b3cf3f4e.description: The recipient of this badge demonstrated entrepreneurship principles and practices in an academic credit course in which one or two learning goals required the student to demonstrate skills including, but not limited to, making decisions, recognizing opportunities, turning ideas into action, pursuing knowledge, creating community, solving problems, overcoming obstacles, and building a personal brand.
c730d1c8-b5d6-453d-bd34-0123b3cf3f4e.name: Student Innovator

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: The recipient of this badge earned a B or higher in a course specifically designed to teach learning goals focused on the tenets of entrepreneurship.

f9aa25a0-7919-4a4b-8cdb-9d52cc11c85a.description: This accomplishment verifies student participation in the Student Research Experience. This program provides students with an opportunity to employ the research process to gather data, information, and/or facts on a specific problem or issue, with the goal of advancing knowledge in an academic discipline.
f9aa25a0-7919-4a4b-8cdb-9d52cc11c85a.name: Undergraduate Research

Share research findings in written and/or oral format.
Merit of project and sharing method verified by an appropriate faculty member.

db41c4cd-0ed9-4951-9855-e8d0ef46998d.description: Verifies participation in Honors@Bucks, a program challenging high-achieving, intellectually curious students with honors coursework emphasizing scholarly research, high-order critical thinking, and experiential learning.
db41c4cd-0ed9-4951-9855-e8d0ef46998d.name: Honors@Bucks

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Acceptance to the Honors@Bucks program
Successful completion of at least one designated-honors course
Scholarly research, high-order critical thinking, and/or experiential learning
3.0 or higher GPA in honors coursework at the time of completion of the first semester of honors coursework
3.25 or higher cumulative Bucks County Community College GPA at the time of completion of the first semester in which student conducted honors

7d016e2c-95b5-4aa0-b59d-04e806d7f610.description: Mastery of social media marketing: Describe the evolution of social media marketing and identify related legal and ethical issues related to businesses use; Explain how to develop effective social media marketing strategies; Analyze the major social media marketing sites that can be used to promote a company, brand, product, or person; and Develop a social media marketing plan and demonstrate how to track progress in achieving goals with a variety of measurement tools, services, and metrics.
7d016e2c-95b5-4aa0-b59d-04e806d7f610.name: Social Media Marketing

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion (C or better) of MKTG230 Social Media Marketing.

b05a7636-ae2d-402a-8c77-8a3e828b56a2.description: Mastery of the use of digital information and communication technology demonstrated by explaining the challenges and opportunities that digital technologies present to marketers, applying digital marketing concepts by analyzing a company's web presence, analyzing essential digital tools and social media employed to achieve marketing goals, creating effective digital marketing content and evaluating digital marketing plans and strategies for effectiveness.
b05a7636-ae2d-402a-8c77-8a3e828b56a2.name: Digital Marketing

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion (C or better) of MKTG220 digital marketing.

5c698248-2216-4da7-aaf5-52ce30eab2c6.description: Students are nominated by Bucks County Community College for membership based on academic standing and leadership potential. The NSLS provides a step-by-step program for members to build their leadership skills. Upon completion of the program, members are formally inducted and receive their leadership certificate.
5c698248-2216-4da7-aaf5-52ce30eab2c6.name: Inducted Member of The National Society of Leadership and Success

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Provide life-time guaranteed membership fee to The National Society of Leadership and Success.
3.2 GPA
6 credits (or more) course work.
Attend an orientation and learn the steps of the leadership development program and the schedule of events for the semester.
Attend leadership training day to learn to identify goals and overcome obstacles and to identify true passions and strengths while creating action steps to achieve goals.

Attend three speaker broadcast events with leaders, celebrities and best-selling authors. Topics include leadership, identifying goals, facing challenges, personal growth, and successfully transitioning from college to career.
Participate in three team meetings to set goals for future success, to practice accountability, and to reflect on the team experience.

Bucks County Community College holds a formal induction ceremony which can be shared with family and friends. At this ceremony, students are presented with their Certificate of Leadership Training honoring their achievement and membership in the NSLS.

d88e8435-f188-4e2a-ac05-a83a74e57345.description: Earning this badge identifies a Bucks County Community College student as a distinguished scholar in an academic credit course.

951d182b-fb7c-45a6-ac86-d01f053a8407.description: Acquired professional skills by demonstrating an understanding and competency of the history of dentistry and dental assisting; introduction to the dental office; the legal aspects of dentistry; policies and guidelines and in clinical aspects such as introduction to oral anatomy; dental operatory; dental equipment; introduction to tooth structure; primary and permanent teeth; the oral cavity and related structures; proper patient positioning; dental hand-pieces; sterilization; and other areas.
951d182b-fb7c-45a6-ac86-d01f053a8407.name: Dental Assisting

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a 100-hour Dental Assisting Program

39cbf0ff-9ee0-4f05-ba8c-380747c6b3e8.description: Students establish a strong introductory foundation in understanding the history, current problems, and future trends of public education. Students can analyze the role of government in public education as well as describe current legal standards which mandate appropriate education for exceptional children. They can explain cultural impact on the theories and practices in the field of education.
39cbf0ff-9ee0-4f05-ba8c-380747c6b3e8.name: Education Studies

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: English 11-1
Biology passing grade on Keystone Exam.

PSYC110 Introduction to Psychology completion and earning a C or higher. Introduction to Psychology is the scientific study of the psychological factors which influence the behavior of individual organisms, both animal and human.

EDUC100 Foundations of Education completion with a C or higher. This course is primarily for students interested in pursuing a career in education. This course provides a survey of the history and philosophy of education with emphasis on current problems in education, on significant educational innovations, and on the school as a social institution. Students complete five hours of observation.

EDUC160 Introduction to Exceptionalities completion with a C or higher. This course provides an overview of the different categories of exceptional learners. The course emphasizes issues in the education of individuals with cognitive impairment, learning disabilities, emotional disturbance, and physical handicaps, including inclusion and other placement options. Students complete five hours of observation.

694ea47f-7260-40a5-8b24-9c9961ed5ab5.description: Badge earners completed training and demonstrated an understanding of Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) characteristics, safety, maintenance. Badge earners built skills to identify emergency situations and to conduct reporting.
694ea47f-7260-40a5-8b24-9c9961ed5ab5.name: FAA Part 107 UAS

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of AFS-600 Regulatory Support Division's FAA ALC-451: Part 107 Small UAS Initial - Part 61 Pilots course

This initiative provides students with an opportunity to research and to report on climate change and/or to participate in a climate change prevention and/or climate change awareness activity.

dc733178-ae88-41c9-8dd2-358dacf94443.name: College Readiness: Summer Bridge

5a18f326-941c-4bd4-855c-6b301837084b.description: The badge earner demonstrates students will demonstrates their expertise with SOLIDWORKS 3D solid modeling software, design concepts, and sustainable design.
5a18f326-941c-4bd4-855c-6b301837084b.name: CSWA Academic Certification

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the CSWA – Academic Exam offered through the SOLIDWORKS Academic Certification Provider program.

65868ed4-761b-428f-9ced-c90c64b82258.description: Earners demonstrate an understanding and mastery of electrocardiogram (EKG) principles and procedures in the health care setting by learning the structure and function of the heart with emphasis on the conduction system, proper lead placement, and interpretation of rhythm strips.
65868ed4-761b-428f-9ced-c90c64b82258.name: EKG Cert

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion (C or better) of HSCI200 Electrocardiography Interpretation.

465d9e27-a6f2-4b61-9fae-5c402c4125cb.description: Students establish a strong introductory framework for understanding and practicing in the paralegal field including civil procedure, the function of the courts, and legal research. Students also gain an understanding of the scope and importance of business law and its fundamental principles, concepts, and rules.
465d9e27-a6f2-4b61-9fae-5c402c4125cb.name: Paralegal Studies

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: English 11-1
Government and Development of Public Policy

LAWS100 Introduction to Paralegal Studies completion earning a C or better. This is a survey course encompassing the varied duties of a paralegal as practiced in Bucks, Montgomery and Philadelphia counties. This course describes work done by paralegals in the following areas: civil procedure, administrative law, legal research, and legal writing.

MGMT 130 Business Law completion earning a C or better. This course examines the fundamentals of Business Law, the legal process and environment within which individuals and business operate, and the relationship of law, business, and the individual. Topics include the basic elements of a contract, the Uniform Commercial Code, and provision on sales and negotiable instruments.
Completion of an additional paralegal studies course at Bucks County Community College. Must earn a C or higher.

bb0402d0-1fb3-4401-8c47-0047effabbd7.description: Students acquire the skills and knowledge to plan, create, and implement effective social media and digital marketing campaigns for small business, corporations, government agencies or non-profit organizations.
bb0402d0-1fb3-4401-8c47-0047effabbd7.name: Social Media and Digital Marketing Studies

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: COLL101 College Success Seminar completion earning a C or higher. Through self-exploration and group interaction, the seminar facilitates students' academic and social integration into the College community and helps build academic success strategies. Students gain knowledge of the College's resources, services, policies, and procedures, and explore various major and career opportunities to develop an academic plan.

VAMM100 Digital Imaging completion earning a C or higher. This studio course presents in-depth techniques for image creation and manipulation using current software applications. Students explore peripherals, file formats, resolution requirements, media storage, and digital photo processing. Emphasis is on image-making methods used to create raster and vector graphics for print and the web.

VAMM110 Web and Interactive Design completion earning a C or higher. This course is an introduction to the XHTML coding and techniques used to create websites. Students learn to design and develop interactive websites using both editors and hand coding skills. Project management and design skills are introduced. The semester culminates in the development of a website.

MKTG230 Digital Marketing compleiton earning a C or higher. This course explores social media marketing principles and best practices for using social media for business, reputation management, and online community building. Students analyze current social networking sites, learning how to use social media to create meaningful relationships with customers, clients, and colleagues. The relevant legal/ethical ramifications are studied.

MKTG220 Digital Marketing completion earning a C or higher. This course examines the basic principles and concepts underlying the use of digital information and communication technology by organizations and consumers. It reviews critical success factors and best practices central to the effectiveness of digital tools and social media.

MKTG280 Marketing Internship completion earning a C or higher. Students participate in an on-the-job experience and observation in a field directly related to their academic preparation and career objectives in marketing/retail. Students periodically review actual experience and observation in the light of theory and skills learned academically with a College Coordinator.

3f9dd9a4-0fd6-4756-a37a-10b3c237c487.description: To earn the badge, a student must complete the following criteria:
3f9dd9a4-0fd6-4756-a37a-10b3c237c487.name: Student Writing Across the College

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a C or higher in two of the following courses: COMP110, COMP111, COMP114, MGMT135, COMP115, COMP116, a JOUR course, VACV130

Earn a C or higher in a Writing-Intensive Course or a Writing-Enhanced Section and submit to the WAC Coordinator verification from the instructor of the course’s writing designation and the student’s solid participation in the writing aspects of the course.

Participate in 2 types of writing community engagement activities: attend Wordsmith Series, enter a Bucks-sponsored writing contest, apply for a Penland Scholarship, participate in the Tyler Literary Society, work as an ASC writing tutor, participate in a Bucks-sponsored public reading, participate in 2 writing ASC appointments, attend a Bucks-sponsored writing workshop, take minutes/conduct correspondence for a Bucks student club/org, complete a con-ed writing course, write/edit the Centurion.

db397709-f6b6-42a1-8707-0a6a5d8d0492.description: Earners identify and describe basic writing-across-the-curriculum principles and methods commonly used to reinforce writing skills. Earners apply these concepts and methods to course and assignment revision with attention to managing workload. Earners describe Bucks’s Writing Across the College (WAC) program, including the Writing Intensive Course (WIC) and Writing Enhanced Section (WES) designations.
db397709-f6b6-42a1-8707-0a6a5d8d0492.name: Writing Intensive/Writing Enhanced Trained

issuer.summary: issued by Bucks Academic Affairs and authorized by Bucks County Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Earner completed a WAC Council/Coordinator-approved training program.
Earner completed the peer review process on an assignment draft and course design that meet the relevant WIC/WES requirements.
